response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and line two 8-inch round cake pans. Sift together 2 cups flour, 1¾ cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, 1½ tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt into a large bowl.",
  "step2": "Add 2 eggs, 1 cup milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla to the dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth. Gradually pour in 1 cup boiling water, mixing until the batter is thin but combined.",
  "step3": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "Turn the cakes out onto a wire rack to cool completely. While cooling, prepare the frosting by beating 1 cup softened butter with 3½ cups powdered sugar, ½ cup cocoa, and ½ tsp salt until creamy.",
  "step5": "Add 2 tsp vanilla and 4-6 tbsp milk to the frosting, beating until light and fluffy. If the frosting is too thick, add more milk one tablespoon at a time until spreadable consistency is achieved.",
  "step6": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a layer of frosting on top. Add the second layer and frost the top and sides. Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles if desired. Serve and enjoy!"
}
